intro: Ancylogyne, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces unique, inflated fruit structures that resemble tiny lanterns, hence its common name. Ancylogyne typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often sought-after species in horticulture and ecological studies.
